AHS has a track record of funding from a variety of federal and state agencies and foundations. Consistently ranked among the top 10 colleges of allied health in research funding, the college’s research emphasis is the intersection of health, disability and rehabilitation.             Asians with Disabilities Outreach Project Think-Tank   Helping vocational research agencies increase their capacity to help and the quality of services for Chicago-based Asian Americans with disabilities through culturally and linguistically appropriate outreach         Biomechanics and Clinical Outcomes Lab   We study gait biomechanics in hip osteoarthritis with the twin goals of understanding the mechanistic role of gait (dys)function in hip osteoarthritis, and improving outcomes in multiple domains, like gait, physical activity, clinical outcomes, and quality of life.         Brain Plasticity Laboratory   Testing and developing low-cost, clinically-translatable therapies that enhance brain plasticity to optimize movement recovery         Center for Capacity Building on Minorities with Disabilities Research   Promoting empowerment of minority individuals with disabilities and capacity building among agencies delivering services to minority populations         Center on Health Promotion   Providing the knowledge and skills necessary for promoting independence, equal opportunity, quality of life and longevity for people with disabilities         Chicagoland Entrepreneurship Education for People with Disabilities   Developing and providing comprehensive entrepreneurship education and training programs for people with disabilities and service providers         Child and Family Development Center   Promoting positive outcomes for young children and their families by working in the areas of community service, research and professional development         Children’s Participation in Environment Research Laboratory   Advancing client-centered care and outcomes in pediatric rehabilitation by harnessing technology to build innovative tools         Cognitive Motor Balance Rehabilitation Laboratory   Examining the effects of various cognitive and motor therapies for improving impairment, function, and participation in older and neurologically impaired populations         Evaluation and Public Policy Unit   Facilitating the public policy debate, legislative activity and advocacy efforts in the disability field through the dissemination of research         Exercise Psychology Laboratory   Researching how to reduce health disparities for racial and ethnic minorities, rural residents, women, children, the elderly and people with disabilities         EXERT Vascular Lab   Concentrating on health-related research across several disciplines using translational cardiovascular approaches         Family Support Research and Training Center   Generating knowledge about the needs and experiences of families who provide support to children and adults with disabilities across the life course         Health Technology Lab   Our goals are to improve access to healthcare, increase adherence, empower patients, and assist healthcare professionals to care for their patients.         Healthy Kids Lab   A safe and engaging community for kids and parents to learn to live life as healthy and happy as possible         Integrative Physiology Laboratory   Integrating cardiovascular function, metabolism, inflammation, hydration, nutrition status and exercise/physical activity         Intentional Relationship Model Clearinghouse   Defining how a client and therapist each contribute to the unique interpersonal dynamic that becomes the therapeutic relationship         Knecht Movement Science Laboratory   Studying rehabilitation while providing training in motor control, biomedical engineering and motor rehabilitation         Locomotor Expertise and Rehabilitation Lab   Investigating why people fall (and why they don’t) with the goal of remediating balance impairment         Model of Human Occupation Clearinghouse   Home to the most widely-cited and utilized occupation-focused practice model in the world         Partners of Refugees in Illinois Disability Employment   Improving vocational rehabilitation and employment options for refugees with disabilities in Illinois and elsewhere                College of Applied Health Sciences           Applying          Degrees and Deadlines    Beyond the Classroom    Tuition and Aid    Newly Admitted Students      Academics          Departments and Programs      Research          Research Labs and Centers    Metabolic Kitchen      Community Services          Assistive Technology Unit    Developmental Disabilities Family Clinic    Occupational Therapy Faculty Practice    Physical Therapy Faculty Practice      Alumni          Give to AHS          Give to AHS    Where to Give      AHS Alumni Awards          Alumni Award Recipients      Meet Our Alumni    Corporate Partners Program    News    Events    Contact      About AHS          College News    College Calendar    Committees    Contact
